events.title: Deutsche Bank forgives $270 million of Trump's Chicago tower debt
events.description: As part of a settlement, Trump's lenders, including Deutsche Bank and Fortress Investment Group, agreed to forgive approximately $270 million of Trump's debt on the Chicago Tower project. This debt forgiveness came after Trump sued Deutsche Bank in 2008 and the bank countersued. Trump paid little to no tax on this windfall by using prior business losses to offset it.

sources.description: Trump Had $270 Million Debt Forgiven on Chicago Skyscraper: NYT - Business Insider

events.title: Trump SoHo hotel-condominium officially opens
events.description: The 46-story Trump SoHo hotel-condominium in Manhattan opens its doors after four years of development. The project was a joint venture between the Trump Organization, Bayrock Group, and the Sapir Organization, with Trump licensing his name and managing the property in exchange for an 18% equity stake.

events.title: Trump University changes name under regulatory pressure
events.description: Under pressure from the New York State Education Department, Trump University changes its name to "The Trump Entrepreneur Initiative" after being found to be operating illegally as an unlicensed educational institution. The name change signaled acknowledgment of regulatory violations as the program faced mounting complaints from former students.

events.title: Trump Entertainment Resorts exits bankruptcy
events.description: Trump's casino holding company, Trump Entertainment Resorts, officially emerges from its third bankruptcy under new ownership. Trump lost majority control but retained a 10% stake and a perpetual licensing agreement for his name on the casinos. The restructuring relieved Trump of further personal obligations for the company's $1+ billion debt.

events.title: Jody Kriss files lawsuit against Bayrock
events.description: Bayrock's former finance director Jody Kriss files a massive lawsuit accusing Bayrock principals Tevfik Arif and Felix Sater of fraud, racketeering, money laundering, tax evasion, and hiding Sater's criminal record from investors and Trump. Although Trump was not a defendant, the lawsuit involved Trump projects like Trump SoHo and alleged they were used as vehicles for fraud.

events.title: Tevfik Arif arrested in Turkey on prostitution charges
events.description: Tevfik Arif, founder of Bayrock Group and Trump's partner on projects like Trump SoHo, is arrested in Turkey during a raid on a $60 million luxury yacht where authorities charged that an underage prostitution ring was operating. Arif was later acquitted of all charges in 2012 after fighting the case for nearly two years.

sources.description: Tevfik Arif | Committee to Investigate Russia

events.title: Russian oligarch Oleg Misevra buys Trump Hollywood penthouse
events.description: Oleg Misevra, a Russian coal magnate from Russia's Far East with ties to Vladimir Putin, pays $6.8 million for the penthouse of Trump Hollywood via an offshore company called "Swiss Residence Aliance Inc." This purchase was part of a wave of Russian investment in Trump-branded properties in Florida.

sources.description: Russian elite invested nearly $100 million in Trump buildings

events.title: Alexander Shnaider directs funds from Russian state bank to Trump Toronto
events.description: After selling his stake in a Ukrainian steel mill to Russian state bank VEB (chaired by Putin) for $850 million, Alexander Shnaider directs approximately $15 million of those proceeds to help complete the struggling Trump International Hotel & Tower in Toronto. This effectively meant Russian state-linked money went into completing a Trump-branded building.

sources.description: Russian Vnesheconombank Helped Finance Trump's Toronto Hotel, Report Says - Business Insider

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer, businessman, and television personality. In 2010, had a significant amount of debt forgiven related to the Chicago tower project, and continued to benefit from Russian investments in his properties.

entity-041.name: Deutsche Bank
entity-041.description: German multinational investment bank and financial services company that provided financing for Trump's Chicago tower project. In 2010, as part of a settlement to a lawsuit filed by Trump, the bank agreed to forgive a substantial portion of Trump's debt.

entity-044.name: Fortress Investment Group
entity-044.description: New York private equity and hedge fund firm that provided a $130 million mezzanine loan to Trump for the Chicago tower project. In 2010, as part of a settlement, the firm agreed to forgive a substantial portion of Trump's debt.

entity-045.name: Trump Entertainment Resorts
entity-045.description: Trump's casino holding company that owned the Trump Taj Mahal, Trump Plaza, and Trump Marina casinos in Atlantic City. Filed for bankruptcy in February 2009 and emerged from bankruptcy in May 2010 with Trump retaining a 10% stake.

entity-047.name: Bayrock Group
entity-047.description: Real estate development and investment company founded by Tevfik Arif that partnered with Trump on multiple projects, including Trump SoHo. Later became the subject of a major lawsuit alleging fraud, money laundering, and tax evasion.

entity-048.name: Sapir Organization
entity-048.description: Real estate development company led by Tamir Sapir, a Soviet-born immigrant, that partnered with Trump and Bayrock Group on the Trump SoHo project in Manhattan.

entity-049.name: Trump Entrepreneur Initiative
entity-049.description: A for-profit real estate seminar program founded by Trump that operated from 2005 until 2010. Initially named Trump University, it was forced to change its name in 2010 after the New York State Education Department determined it was operating illegally as an unlicensed educational institution.

entity-050.name: Jody Kriss
entity-050.description: Former finance director of Bayrock Group who filed a lawsuit in 2010 accusing the company's principals of fraud, racketeering, money laundering, and tax evasion.

entity-051.name: Felix Sater
entity-051.description: Russian-American businessman who was a managing director at Bayrock Group and worked closely with Trump on various real estate projects. Has a criminal past including a 1998 racketeering conviction related to a $40 million stock fraud scheme involving the Russian mafia.

entity-052.name: Oleg Misevra
entity-052.description: Russian coal mining magnate and former regional politician from Russia's Far East who purchased a $6.8 million penthouse in Trump Hollywood via an offshore company in 2010. Known to have connections to Vladimir Putin, who publicly praised his company's work.

entity-053.name: Alexander Shnaider
entity-053.description: Canadian businessman of Soviet-born origins who developed Trump International Hotel & Tower in Toronto. In 2010, he sold his stake in a Ukrainian steel mill to Russian state bank VEB for $850 million and directed approximately $15 million of those proceeds to help complete the Trump Toronto project.

entity-054.name: Vnesheconombank
entity-054.description: Russian state-owned development bank that purchased Alexander Shnaider's stake in a Ukrainian steel mill for $850 million in 2010. At the time, VEB's supervisory board was chaired by Vladimir Putin. Money from this transaction was later used to help complete Trump's Toronto hotel project.

relationships.description: Deutsche Bank forgave a substantial portion of Trump's Chicago tower debt in 2010 as part of a settlement of a legal dispute that began when Trump sued the bank in 2008.
Fortress Investment Group forgave a substantial portion of Trump's Chicago tower debt in 2010 as part of the broader settlement.
Jody Kriss filed a lawsuit against Bayrock Group and its principals in 2010, alleging fraud, racketeering, money laundering, and tax evasion.
Russian state bank VEB purchased Alexander Shnaider's stake in a Ukrainian steel mill for $850 million, with some of those proceeds being directed to help complete the Trump Toronto project.
Russian oligarch Oleg Misevra purchased a $6.8 million penthouse in Trump Hollywood via an offshore company in 2010.

transactions.description: Deutsche Bank and Fortress Investment Group forgave approximately $270 million of Trump's Chicago tower debt as part of a settlement.
transactions.notes: Trump paid little to no tax on this windfall by using prior business losses to offset it as cancellation-of-debt income.

transactions.description: Russian coal magnate Oleg Misevra purchased the penthouse of Trump Hollywood for $6.8 million through an offshore company.
transactions.notes: The purchase was made through an offshore company, masking Misevra's personal name on U.S. property records. The transaction was part of a wave of Russian investment in Trump-branded properties.

transactions.description: Russian state bank VEB purchased Alexander Shnaider's stake in a Ukrainian steel mill for $850 million.
transactions.notes: Approximately $15 million of the proceeds from this sale were directed by Shnaider to help complete the Trump International Hotel & Tower in Toronto.
